item.title: Study | Digital insomnia treatment can combat depression
item.description:
An unprecedented study developed by several universities, including the Chinese Hong Kong University and the University of Beijing, concluded that cognitive behavioral therapy through mobile phone applications can help combat young people by monitoring insomious. The rate of disease reduction is about 40 percent
The study “Effectiveness of Cognitive Behavioral Therapy Based on insomnia for insomnia in the prevention of Major depressive disorder in insomnia and subclinical depression: a random clinical trial” [Effectiveness of App-Based Cognitive Behavioral Therapy for Insomnia on Preventing Major Depressive Desorder Inorder Whit Insomnia and Subclinical Depression: Randomized clinical trial] promises answers to the treatment of cases of depression in the younger ones. The work, published by PLOS MEDICINE magazine and developed by academics from various universities in Hong Kong and China, included the University of Hong Kong, Chinese Hong Kong University or the University of Beijing, concludes that it is possible to reduce, by about 40 percent, cases of depression in young people using a mobile phone application that monitors insoponials, a habitual symptoms, a symptom in the one who suffers from the sufferers illness. The data were presented at the end of last week in Hong Kong. To reach the results, a random sample of more than 700 young Chinese from the interior of China and Hong Kong with insomnia disturbance and depressive symptoms, aged 15 to 25 years, who underwent testing with application for six weeks, was chosen. Thus, “this controlled and random study evaluated the efficacy of cognitive behavioral therapy for application based on application (TCC-I) in preventing the future appearance of Major Depressive Disturbance (MDD) in young people” can be read. This at a time when "more and more evidence suggests that insomnia plays an important role in the development of depression," in this investigation "intervention in insomnia as a promising approach to prevent depression in young people." Thus, “applications based TCC-I is effective in preventing the future appearance of major depression and improving the results of insomnia among young people with insomnia and subclinical depression”. The study also concludes that "these results underline the importance of aiming at insomnia to prevent the appearance of DMG [a type of depression] and enhance the need for greater dissemination of digital TCC-I to promote sleep and mental health in the young population." It is also concluded that the TCC-I based on applications "not only improved night insomnia symptoms, but also reduced daytime fatigue and led to greater change to maturity." More than 700 young people analyzed After testing the application of TCC-I, base clinical interviews were conducted over a period of six to 12 months to understand the results in participants and monitor symptoms. We spoke, in the period between September 9, 2019 and November 25, 2022, of 708 participants, of which 407 was women (57 percent), with an average ages of 22 years. The study also points out that “37 participants, 10 percent, in the intervention group and 62 participants, 18 percent, in the control group developed new mood disturbances over the 12 months of follow -up”. In turn, the group that was subject to CBT-I based on mobile phone application, ie cognitive behavioral therapy for insomnia, presented “rates of remission of insomnia disturbance higher than post-intervention control groups” within one year. In addition, the same group "reported a greater decrease in depressive symptoms than post-intervention controls and over six months of follow-up." The authors of the study understand that "insomnia was a mediator of the effects of intervention on depression", and no adverse events related to interventions were reported. " The authors left for this study with some proven ideas that insomnia is one of the main causes for depression. "Emerging data on insomnia intervention, especially cognitive behavioral therapy for insomnia (TCC-I), have shown promising results in insomnia relief and depressive symptoms in patients with insomnia," he reads. Existing investigations focus on adults and elderly, so it was important to analyze this matter among the younger ones. "In addition, there are few studies with suitable statistical power to demonstrate the preventive effect of TCC-I on depression, both at the level of symptoms and disturbances," explains the study authors, stressing that "little is known about whether the digital insomnia intervention can potentially prevent youthful depression." Important meanings The study also points out that cognitive behavioral therapy for applications based on insomnia is a viable and effective intervention to prevent future depression at both symptoms and disturbances in young people. ” However, further studies are recommended to explore “the integration of application-based TCC-I in clinical practice to improve accessibility and prevent depression among the young population”. It is also mentioned the need for more clinical trials “to explore the potential benefits of adapting digital interventions on sleep in relief and prevention of depression” in order to “move towards personalized and staggered care approaches to the community”. Limitations are referred to in this study published in “PLOS Medicine”, namely “the inclusion of a mixture of individuals with and without prior depression, and a limited sample of adolescents, although there was an adequate global sample”. To the Hong Kong press, the study authors spoke of the importance of these results and how they can constitute new tools in future treatments of the disease. Quoted by The Standard HK, Chen Si-Jing, the first author of the Postdoctoral Research and Psychiatry Department of the Chinese University of Hong Kong, said the study "shows that Digital TCC-I is effective in preventing the future appearance of severe depression, with satisfactory effectiveness." Wing Yun-Kwok, director of the Li Chiu Kong family sleep evaluation unit, indicated that future studies will focus on digital intervention on insomnia in clinical practice. The unprecedented character of this study in Asia still gives him greater importance. According to Lu Lin, an academic at the Chinese Academy of Sciences and president of the PKU Sixth Hospital, to date "no investigation in Asia had been carried out on the effectiveness of this therapy."

item.title: Diplomacy | Macao Platform seen in the context of Chinese foreign policy
item.description:
In "Paradiplomacy in China: Macao's role in relations between sino-Portuguese countries," Xu Heng Wang concludes that the role of platform with Lusophony "can be seen with extension of China's foreign policy." However, the MSar presents its own ideas, without “complete obedience to the central government”, indicates the academic
Macao's diplomatic role in the relationship with China and Portuguese -speaking countries was the focus of Xu Heng Wang's doctoral thesis defended in January at the University of Coimbra (UC) Faculty of Economics. In “Paradiplomacy in China: Macao's role in relations between sino-Portuguese countries”, the author argues that, regarding the role of Economic and Commercial Platform of MSA in the connection of Beijing and Portuguese-speaking countries, there is a certain extent of Chinese foreign policy, but at the same time, ideas proper to local authorities. "Although the role of Macao as an economic and commercial platform can be seen as an extension of China's foreign policy, this does not mean that Macau is in a state of complete obedience to the central government," is referred to in research work. Although it is stressed that “it is difficult to discern Macao's desire to develop, it must be mentioned that Macau has his own ideas about the course of his development”, namely in relation to the game and the entire economic structure. “Macao has long foresaw that the structure of his economy would be unbalanced and that the game would be dominant. Authorities and academics have also made many debates on the issue of unsustainable development based on the game industry. At the same time, Macau is also very aware of its advantages in terms of cultural integration, having carried out the construction of a historic and cultural city, becoming a tourist attraction. ” Between the own ideas and what is defined in the field of foreign policy by Beijing, there is "a direction of the development of Macao which, basically, is consistent with the role that the central government has conceived to Macao." In this context, the author concludes that “the interests of Macao and the Central Government are basically the same”, being “a special case of paradiplomacy in China”, due to the implementation of politics “a country, two systems” in the territory and the high degree of autonomy it provides in various areas. THE ROLE OF THE MACAU FORUM Xu Heng Wang took a different approach on this issue, not resorting to traditional international relations theories, because “Macao interactions involve both state and non-state actors,” so these theories “do not provide an accurate explanation of Macao's role”. Thus, and to understand the role of Macau in the relations between China and the Portuguese -speaking countries, the idea of ​​paradiplomacy with Guanxi theory, a term used to describe social, economic or political relationships that can enhance business or other benefits, was combined. Thus, it is said that "the creation of the Macau Forum can be considered one of the prominent paradiplomatic activities," with "Macao playing a role that mixes its development with the strategic objectives of the Chinese central government, especially with regard to Portuguese -speaking countries." Macao has performed some relevant activities in the relations between China and Portuguese-speaking countries, ”although it is assumed that“ the results have been limited so far ”. The academic states that these activities are "mainly concentrated in the fields of economics, education, tourism, culture and technology, with political effects that are not yet so evident." In addition, it is pointed out that "the influence of Macau on the relations between China and the different Portuguese -speaking countries has varied in intensity." Still, "much of the interaction and cooperation between Macao, China and the Portuguese -speaking countries occurred through the Macao Forum." Help with objectives In general terms, the “paradiplomacy of Macao is a complex and fluid process”, and the territory “shows its identity as a world tourism and leisure center and a characteristic financial center with international activities”, with the aim of “improving economic structure” and making diversification beyond game. The author highlights fundamental areas such as services for small and medium enterprises, exchange-cultural and formation of bilingual talents. In addition, it is explained that “the central government provides political support to Macau based on its foreign policy needs, with the reinforcement of cooperation” with Portuguese -speaking countries. In these actions, include the Great Bay project, as well as the idea of ​​Macao's establishment as the Renminbi Compensation Center (RMB). “On the one hand, the central government provides conveniences to Macau and helps [the territory] to establish its identity, 'supported by the mainland China market'. On the other hand, it helps Macau to develop the activity of RMB compensation center for transactions that occur on the Macao negotiation platform. ” Thus, it denotes the author, "the role of Macao in paradiplomacy, but as an assistant to the implementation of central foreign policy, is also evident." However, "the paradiplomacy of Macao does not only reflect the diplomatic objective of helping the Chinese government to establish relations with Portuguese -speaking countries, but also the improvement of Macau's own international influence." The doctoral thesis also presents a practical case analysis of Macau's relationship with the most striking Portuguese -speaking countries in the economic relationship with China, namely Angola and Brazil. "For Angola, Macao has played an approach role to China," as the African country needs "foreign investment for the hydroelectric power, infrastructure and agriculture sector." Thus, the binding axis is made at the Macao Forum, where "Angola can establish relations with the Chinese central government and cooperate on investment, in addition to the oil sector." In addition, "most of China's investment in Angola comes from large companies, while small and medium -sized companies still depend mainly on Macau for commercial cooperation." In the case of Brazil the situation is slightly different, because “in sino-Brazilian relations, the role of Macao is not obvious”, more “centered around the BRICS”, a group of emerging economies initially founded by Brazil, Russia, India and China, which today has ten member countries. “Although the first ministerial meeting of the Macao Forum (2003) preceded the first meeting of the BRICS (2009) leaders, the impact of the Macao Forum on Sino-Brazilian Relations is not obviously as good as the influence established through direct meetings. Therefore, in the early days of the establishment of diplomatic relations between China and Brazil, relations between the two countries developed more at national level. ” It is also highlighted that "although the role that Macao has in the opening of a door to the mainland China market has been established in Brazil's eyes, the impact of Macau on sino-Brazilian relations has not yet become obvious." It is certain, however, that in recent years "the continuous development of the Macao Forum and the continuous improvement of organizational activities, its attraction to Brazil has become increasingly evident." “As Brazil tries to expand trade, commercial cooperation and investment with China will no longer be concentrated only in national business giants and will be increasingly targeted at private companies,” is still completed. Regarding Portugal, the “attitude is very positive”, to the existing historical connection. “In many memos and statements signed with China, Macau has been stated to play an increasingly important role as a link between China and Portugal. Portugal and China have great technical cooperation in the domains of new energies, aerospace industry and other technological innovations. There is also a profound relationship of cooperation in the field of education. ” It is also noteworthy that Portugal “not only signed cooperation agreements in the field of teaching with universities in the interior of China, but also signed several cooperation and exchange agreements with the main universities of Macao”.

item.title: Macau Pass | Elderly guest to sign candidacy when exchanging card
item.description:
One resident claimed that his grandmother was invited to sign a filed report for legislative elections while trying to change the Macau Pass card to the elderly for the great consumption award. The deadline for presenting the application commissions ends on June 6
“My grandmother wanted to change the Macau Pass card to the elderly and went to some associations. When dealing with the process to change the card, the association's employee asked my grandmother if he could sign a proposal bulletin for the elections. ” The allegation of electoral use of the replacement processes of the “Macau Pass card for the elderly” was yesterday reported by a listener of the “Macao Forum” program of the Chinese channel of Radio Macau. The listener, nicknamed Wong, described in a nutshell the state of confusion in which her grandmother was after her after they asked her to sign the bulletin during the exchange process. “My grandmother was confused and bothered by the situation. She just wanted to replace Macau Pass, without getting involved in electoral matters and was thinking that the card exchange could be related to the signature of the newsletter, ”he said. The resident was also incredulous in the face of how the card replacement process is processed. “When I saw the presentation of the program, I noticed that the replacement of the cards is coorganized by the Institute of Social Action. I do not realize why the Institute of Social Action does not directly deal with the replacement of the cards, just as it receives requests and documents for the assignment of subsidies, ”said the listener. Process in course Until March 20, 60 posts for the free replacement of the “Macau Pass Card for the Elderly” are open throughout the territory, between social service institutions and civic associations. Change of cards is required for residents over 65 who have old versions of Macau Pass for the elderly, as these cards have a chip that cannot be supported to get immediate discount of the great consumption award. It is recalled that the measure starts on March 24 and, for the first time, offers the mode of use of Macau Pass so as not to exclude from the elderly program that do not know how to use online payment platforms. On the other hand, the Electoral Affairs Commission of the Legislative Assembly began last week to make available the forms to build candidates. The deadline for applications, with the signatures required by law, ends on June 6. The elections are scheduled for September 14. HM has sent questions to the Electoral Affairs Committee of the Legislative Assembly and the public entities that organize the exchange of cards and the major consumption award (Institute of Social Action and Directing of Economics and Technological Development Services) to ask if there would be any case in an investigation related to electoral actions during the exchange of Macau Pass. Until the closing of this edition, no answers were obtained.

item.title: Homes of Elderly | Lo Choi in defends incentives for private
item.description:
The deputy linked to the community of Jiangmen warns of the lack of beds in the elderly homes in Macao. Faced with population aging, Lo Choi In defends the incentive to develop alternatives to public resources
Given the aging of the population of Macao, Lo Choi in alerted to the lack of beds in elderly homes and defends the promotion of the private sector. The subject was addressed in a interpeação written by the deputy linked to the community of Jiangmen. According to the accounts presented in the interpellation, there are currently 2,510 beds in elderly homes, a number that has not increased since 2021, a circumstance which the deputy explained with the pandemic. By 2028, it is expected that the number of beds will increase up to 3,600, which is due to the opening of new homes in zone A of new landfills. However, the numbers are insufficient in the optics of Lo Choi In, not only due to the expected aging of the population, but because it cites reports from experts to indicate that the minimum acceptable number would be 4 beds in homes of elderly per 1,000 inhabitants. In Macao, the average number is 3.4 beds per 1,000 inhabitants. The deputy also points out that despite the official information about these numbers not always being the most transparent, the data provided by the Executive allows you to determine that by 2028 there will be a deficit of 400 beds. In the ideal scenario, it indicates that by 2026 there should be 5,200 beds in elderly homes, based on the recommendations of the Economic Cooperation and Development Organization (OECD) and the World Health Organization (WHO). However, this bar will not be realized. More Private Market Given this situation, Lo Choi in asks the government to invest more resources in the availability of beds, but also to promote the development of the private sector, with the distribution of land reserve land and the implementation of the support policy. "In recent years, in many countries and neighboring regions, the private care market for the elderly has been developing vigorously, which not only satisfies the needs of the community and reduces the government's burdens, but also creates a large number of jobs," he says. The deputy adds that "in Macao, demand is also increasing and, even if the government is willing to invest public resources, it is still difficult to satisfy the demand." “Is the government considering releasing more public land and creating political incentives for the development of private homes?” He asks. Lo Choi also asked if the government equates the role of the private market in response to the needs of the community within the policy for the elderly. In addition to land, Lo Choi in admits that it is difficult to attract workers to this sector, because most professions are not considered attractive to residents. The legislature thus wants to know if there may be a flexibility of hiring non-residents.

item.title: Work | Leong Sun Iok wants residents in the corporate bosses
item.description:
At game dealers, the proportion of local professionals in intermediate or high management positions was last year of about 90 percent. Deputy Leong Sun IOK wants the government to encourage companies from other sectors to follow the example of the concessionaires
Leong Sun Iok wants large companies that do not belong to the game sector to follow the example of casino concessionaires in terms of recruitment policies and human resource management. The intervention takes into account the goal set by the government that states that concessionaires have at least 85 percent of the staff that occupy intermediate or high management positions delivered to Macao residents. The deputy of the Federation of Macao Workers' Associations (Faom) argues that the government should encourage business tissue to adopt a similar policy that gives priority to places in more wage -like work. It is recalled that, according to data from the Directorate of Statistics and Census Services, the income of game management professionals increased 22.2 percent in 2024 to an average of 68,900 patacas. Given these data, Leong Sun IOK defended, in statements to the Exmooo newspaper, that the Executive promotes the upward mobility of residents' careers and access to positions with better salary conditions, and argues that not only should game companies take on social responsibilities. The deputy states that although Macao's unemployment rate is low, it is currently very difficult to access jobs with good remuneration. Hole However, the deputy of Faom also pointed to batteries to the game dealers, starting with the total volume of the labor hired by the sector. At the end of 2024, the number of game companies employees totaled 52,971 people. Despite the annual increase of 1,200 workers, Leong Sun Iok highlights the big difference for 2019, when the labor totaled 58,225 people. The discrepancy is even more incomprehensible to the lack of human resources, according to the deputy, since it is common for workers to do overtime. In fact, Leong Sun IOK explains the 2.5 percent salary increase last year precisely with the overtime made by dealership employees. Another area where the government needs to intervene, is at the entrance of newly graduated young people in the labor market. In this chapter, the deputy of Faom highlights once again the social responsibility that should not only fall on game dealers, in particular when opportunities are denied to young people without work experience.

item.title: Pecuniary checks 2025
item.description: Recently, due to the reduction of revenues from the taxation of the game, an effect caused by the pandemic, there were three currents of opinion in Macao that argue that the government should review the policy of distribution of pecuniary checks. The first stream claims that benificaries should live in Macau at least 183 days a year to enjoy this check in the amount of 10,000 patacas. However, those who live in the Great Bay area would not be covered by this measure. The second current believes that a timeline should be created, where the conditions will be different. This method can be synthesized in this way, "for the new residents the new system, for the old residents the old system." This will also be a way to reduce the expenses of the pecuniary check distribution plan. The third lawyer is that instead of surrendering checks should be placed at 10,000 Patacas on consumer cards to encourage residents to make their purchases in Macao, thus encouraging the city's economy, benefiting the population and helping to increase government revenues from taxes. Before analyzing these three currents of opinion, it is necessary to understand the government's financial situation. In September 2024, the financial reserves were approximately 617 billion. In the budget for 2025, it is expected that the executive's revenues will be about 121 billion patacas, the expenses will be around 113.3 billion and the gross profit from the game sector will be in 240 billion. Based on this calculation, by 2025, the government will have a financial surplus and tax reserves may cover about five years of expenses, which indicates signs of stability. So why did these currents of opinion emerged? Because before the pandemic, revenues from the game sector taxing that reached the 300 billion of patacas annually fell by over 200 billion during the epidemic. This value was slowly recovering and reached 230 billion in 2024, so the budget surplus was very reduced. According to the “living within our possibilities” principle stipulated in the Macao Basic Law, the government must consider the reasonable way to cut in expenses, which will comply with the provisions of the Basic Law. Although the measures that defend these three currents reduce the funds that the government allocates to the implementation of the plan, its essence, as an important policy to support the subsistence of residents, it is allowing everyone to share the fruits of economic development, increasing their sense of belonging and their satisfaction. As long as you have a Macao Identity Ticket and if you are a city resident, part of the shared money can be received. Therefore, the imposition of any kind of conditions could compromise the equity and inclusion of the plan. As soon as a situation is established in which “some have no right and others” will certainly create social dissatisfaction and controversy. In order to maintain the essence, objective and characteristics of the plan, as much as possible taking into account the government's financial capabilities, the fairer form is that the setbacks and the advances focus on all residents. If the amount of pecuniary checks fall from the current 10,000 patacas, it will be in accordance with the principle “Living within our possibilities”, but being equitable, it will affect the lowest income families and is not feasible. Also, with a tax surplus and large tax reserves, why not consider the possibility of increasing the value of pecuniary checks instead of reducing it? With the reduction of tax revenues, it is natural for the government to save by optimizing expenses and improving the effectiveness of tax funds. At the same time, the government should also actively explore the path of moderate economic diversification, reduce game industry dependence and increase revenue. And how can this be done in practice? Recently, mainland China has resumed the policy “a visa, multiple trips”, which has undoubtedly injected a new vitality in the economic recovery of the Macao Tourism sector. The government must take this opportunity to increase advertising and promote efforts to attract more tourists. It should also simultaneously encourage stores to innovate their business model, develop special products and improve the quality of service to meet the different needs of tourists. The government estimates that by 2025 Macao receives 36 million tourists. The city organized several successful concerts in 2024, which not only brought considerable economic benefits to the region, but also gave new ideas for the functioning of the moderate diversification of the economy. The government must continue to support and encourage this way and also exploit similar cultural tourism projects to promote the region's prosperity. Only increasing tax revenues can the plan remain unchanged and all continue to receive their part and enjoy good economic results. In short, as an important subsistence support policy, the continuation of implementation and the improvement of the plan are of great importance to increase the sense of belonging and satisfaction of residents. When the government faces tax pressures such as reducing the game sector, it should adopt a prudent attitude and seek fair and reasonable solutions to ensure that the plan continues to play the role due to it. If government revenues return to pre-standard levels, the question of modifying the plan will naturally disappear. item.title: With fate in the hands
item.description: “My destiny is in my hands,” is a speech by Ne Zha, the protagonist of the Chinese animation series “Ne Zha 2”, which represents the way of thinking of a bolder younger generation that boldly challenges those in power. To some extent, whether the romance and the film, they criticize the current state of society. The protagonist wins the audience and the film naturally became a tremendous success. The inhabitants of Macao, who face the current economic situation, should also say "our destiny is in our hands"? The Government of MSAR has finally announced that it will relaunch the “big consumption award”, which this year will take place of March 24 June 1, to help small and medium -sized SMEs and stimulate local consumption. Its promotional initiative also provides “immediate discount for elderly consumption”. The elderly can get immediate discounts on consumption of 300 patacas through the new version of the “Macau Card for the Elderly”. Although the goodwill of the RAE government is evident, will it really improve the difficult situation of SMEs? Currently, the difficulties faced by Macao's SMEs result from the enormous consumption of Macao residents in mainland cities and the challenges placed by changing their buying patterns. Compared to the various cities of the Great Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macau Bay, operating costs, goods prices and sales services in Macau are at a disadvantage. For example, the price of 95 octane gasoline in mainland China is about 9 patacas per liter, while in Macao usually costs about 13 patacas. No wonder the drivers of Macao will return from the interior of China, with the car's deposit completely full. In addition, the stretch of Street of S. Paulo next to Rua da Palha is very busy, while more than a third of the stores ranging from Travessa da Paixão to Rua de Santo António are closed. What will help take the big prize to revitalize the economy of these streets and surroundings? Given the adversities, the MSAR government shows the desire to change, but unfortunately there is still a significant space for an improvement in recognition and response to change. The crucial task is to break the monopoly of the installed interests. Take as an example the Law of Economic Housing. At the time of the Portuguese Administration of Macao, Economic Housing served to resolve residents' housing issues and the owners of these homes were allowed to sell them, creating a market adjustment with properties at reasonable prices. When I was deputy of the Legislative Assembly, the working group to which it belonged was responsible for the analysis of the specialty of the law entitled “Economic Housing Law”. The Legislative Assembly diary published that the deputies of the Association of Novo Macao, where I included myself, opposed the proposal to establish a deadline for the non -transferability of acquired economic housing and condition the purchase of economic housing by young people. With strong institutional support, the “Economic Housing Law” has passed, and subsequent revisions became increasingly strict. While some people have been satisfied because “economic housing has always to maintain the same nature, not being an investment”, but have you any idea how many young people were “enslaved by mortgages” when they bought home? In Macao, only 3,600 babies were born in the dragon year (2024), a number less than 3,700 born in the rabbit year (2023). Some estimates point to 3,500 the number of those who will be born this year, and this number is already quite optimistic. But why is “denatality” gaining strength? Former Macao Chief Executive, Hau Wah, had the visionary idea of ​​proposing fractions of the “Mong In Building”, located at Francisco Xavier Pereira Street, to lease to newlyweds, providing young couples with a social housing option and relieving them from the heavy housing credit, allowing them to raise their children with peace of mind. Unfortunately, Mr. Ho's proposal has not advanced and young people who want to marry and buy an apartment have no choice but to resort to the private real estate market. Even with their parents' help, young people have to pay mortgages over one million patacas! Now, with the decline real estate market, the apartments they bought are devalued. You should ask, how can they be willing to make babies? Without breaking the double monopoly of economics and politics, we can only "resign to destiny" rather than believing that "my destiny is in my own hands"!

item.title: FRC | Debate on Portuguese Language next Monday
item.description: The Rui Cunha Foundation (FRC) presents on Monday, 17, at 6.30 pm, a session of the “Roda de Ideas” cycle, entitled “The Potential of the Portuguese Language in the Contemporary World”, with the participation of the former Rector of ISCTE-University Institute of Lisbon, Luís Reto, and the Associate Rector of the University of Macau School, José Paulo Esperança. The event will be moderated by Marco Duarte Rizzolio, president of AEIMCP and co-founder of the “929 Challenge” entrepreneurship program. The invited speakers are co-authors of the book “Novo Atlas of the Portuguese Language”, a work released by ISCTE-IUL in 2016, which seeks to be a contribution to the affirmation of the value and potential of a unique heritage, in a multidisciplinary and integrative approach, mirror of the multiple realities of its speakers, describes the FRC in a statement. According to AEIMCP-Macau Entrepreneurship and Innovation Association-China and Portuguese-speaking countries, co-organizer of the event, the session will address the historical, cultural and geostrategic importance of the Portuguese language in the contemporary world. "The discussion will cover the historical factors that shaped the expansion of the Portuguese language, its economic and geostrategic influence, as well as the challenges and opportunities related to the promotion and teaching of Portuguese on a global scale," says the association, cited by the same note. In addition, “the seminar will reflect on the possible future trajectories of the Portuguese language in the 21st century”, also exploring “the role of Lusophone countries in the global scene, and how the Portuguese language can continue to expand its cultural, economic and educational relevance”, the organization says.

item.title: FAM | Portugal represented with “Bate Fado” show
item.description:
Yesterday was presented the poster of another edition of the Macao Arts Festival (FAM), which starts in April, and brings the show “Bate Fado” representing Portuguese culture. Also highlight for another theatrical production in Patuá dos Doci Papiaem di Macau, with “ass reindeer?”, Which looks at the uniqueness of the territory
The show “Bate Fado”, by the Portuguese duo of choreographers Jonas & Lander, is one of the highlights of the 35th edition of the Macao Arts Festival (FAM), which starts in late April, was announced yesterday. The president of the Macao Cultural Institute (ICM) justified the invitation to the duo Jonas Lopes and Lander Patrick with the desire to “include activities or groups with special characteristics”. "We know Fado and have promoted fado shows," said Leong Wai Man at a press conference. The leader recalled the nights of fado with Portuguese singers, held at the D. Pedro V Theater, in the first half of 2024, as well as the collaboration between fadista Mariza and the Chinese orchestra of Macao, in the last edition of the region's International Music Festival. “We hope it is new, since it is not just fado, it is a body performance that fuses singing and dance,” said Leong. During the presentation of the FAM program, the ICM said that "Bate Fado", scheduled for May 17, "combines the emotional music with the tap dancing, evoking old Tabernas from Lisbon." In a video shown during the performance, the duo Jonas & Lander said the show “rescues the extinct dances of fado” and stressed that it will still guide a dancer workshop and another for families with children between 8 and 12 years. “Bate Fado” will also be part of an outdoor show, free admission, on May 16, 17 and 18, in the Iao Hon market garden, whose program also includes the Casa de Portugal Association in Macao. In 2023, Jonas Lopes told Lusa that “hits fado” intends to recover the nineteenth -century tradition of the beaten fado, which rhythmicly consisted of following the fadist melody compass, beating one foot or both at the same time, possibly with a choreography. With a budget of 23.4 million patacas, six percent less than in 2024, FAM will present, between April 25 and May 31, 15 shows and 33 opera, dance, music and theatrical arts, in a program that includes seven local groups. On May 24th the small auditorium of the Macau Cultural Center receives “the shaman's beat”, from the Tago group and Kook's direction and choreography. It is a show with the “fresh and young breeze of the traditional rhythms” of South Korea, which moves away from pop music. “The shaman's beat is a masterful demonstration of precision and movement, a representation of old rituals with an appealing contemporary touch,” reads the program. On May 17th and 18th, “Kiki, the Apprentice of Witch-The Musical”, with dramaturgy by Kouki Kishimoto. This musical debuted in 2017 and since then it has taken the stage more than 70 times in Japan, having "a young and energetic cast." This is the “first outside tour” of the group, described in the poster. More Patuá As is tradition, the Dóci Papiaçá di Macao, end the festival with the play “Cuza Tá Rena?” (What is going on?), In Patuá. The theater in this Creole of Portuguese origin has been part of the list of Chinese National Intangible Cultural Heritage since 2021, underlined Leong Wai Man. On the sidelines of the presentation, the Dóci stagnant Papyam, Miguel Senna Fernandes, said the play, with a center of explanations as a background, will be "a call of attention" to the importance of "maintaining the origin characteristics of Macao." The director recalled that during a passage in the region in December, Chinese President Xi Jinping stressed that Macau is “the only place in the world that has Portuguese and Chinese officials” and argued that the city has to enjoy “its uniqueness”. In a speech during the inauguration of the new local government, Xi said that Macau has the "unique advantage of being the mix of different cultures", but warned that the territory needs "a more tolerant attitude, more open." In the last FAM, the Dóci Papiam were caught by surprise when, for the first time, local authorities asked the script of the piece before this debut, giving as justification the need to make the age classification of the show. Leong Wai Man assured that this is "essentially the reason" why the script of all the shows presented to the public to Macao is evaluated by a commission, to "know if it can be seen by kids and big ones."

item.title: Fisherman's Dock | RUC's anniversary is celebrated this Saturday
item.description: The DD3 Verandah disco, at the fishermen's dock, is preparing to host this Saturday the RUC-Radio University of Coimbra Radio Party. The event, which starts at 23h, has a DJ set with local names linked to the radio, namely “Battle”, “DJ Sleppy” and “Tongrim”. Margarida Sajara, speaker of TDM Radio Macau, is the special guest. Tickets cost 180 patacas and entitle you to three drinks. RUC celebrated 39 years of existence on March 1, and in Portugal the celebration program is filled with several emissions at the University Radio Studios. The year 1986 marks the date on which the experimental radio center has become RUC, being, to this day, a local radio of Coimbra, but also a learning space for young radio broadcasters and announcers, many of them out of journalism or media courses. The 39th Anniversary program is highlighted the show with “Telectu”, scheduled for March 29 at the Academic Theater Gil Vicente. item.title: IC activity considered innovative by UNESCO
item.description: The World Heritage Institute for Training and Research in the UNESCO Asia-Pacific Region (Whitrap) considered that the activity of the Cultural Institute (IC), entitled “Come to know our world heritage better” is innovative, having been classified as a “innovative case” for the “Youth Education Base on World Heritage” of 2024. According to the IC, the initiative that runs at the Mandarin House "was selected as one of China's ten innovative cases in 2024, a distinction that fully recognizes the work of the Cultural Institute in the context of youth education on world heritage." The IC also points out that since the restoration of the Mandarin House in 2010, that this space has been actively used to organize various cultural promotion activities with young people, in order to guide them in understanding the value of world heritage. ” The aim of the IC is also to “make known to young people the cultural characteristics of the encounter between Chinese and Western cultures in Macao, cultivating a sense of patriotism, strengthening cultural self -confidence and spreading traditional Chinese culture”. Distinction in 2018 Casa do Mandarin entered UNESCO's “Education Base” in 2018, and the activities to celebrate local heritage also enter the same list. These activities aim to “encourage creative thinking and cultivate cultural innovation and creative young people through innovative and fun experiences, namely Chinese painting, sculpture, ceramics, design, 3D printing, building blocks and other artistic and educational activities, with the historic center of Macau as the main theme”. An online session of short films of cartoons on the historic center of Macao and other didactic resources was also launched. The selection by the Whitrap “is an important recognition of the work of CI in the context of youth education on world heritage”, is also mentioned. This year, a new group reserve service will be performed for this activity. The IC also promises to "continue to use the Mandarin House as the basis for organizing more dissemination and training activities for young people, in order to enhance the role and mission of the" Youth Education Base on World Heritage ".

item.title: Measles | Macau advises vaccine to those who travel to the US
item.description:
The government advised residents who are not immune to measles who are vaccinated before traveling to the United States, where an outbreak has infected more than 200 people
Health services (SS) appealed to all macao inhabitants vaccinated “before traveling to areas where measles is endemic” in the United States of America, according to a statement released Monday night. "Recently, there have been a lot of measles outbreaks in the United States and countries such as Philippines and Vietnam are also being affected by the low measles vaccination rate, resulting in cases," the SS said. Residents who were born from 1970 are pointed out as a priority group for vaccination, free through marking at public health centers. This is because, although the measles vaccine was introduced by the then Portuguese administration in Macau in the late 1960s, the vaccination rate remained low until the early 1980s. According to the latest report by the US Disease Control and Prevention Centers (CDC) in the United States, the country has already recorded almost 230 measles during the current outbreak. The overwhelming majority of cases (94 percent) reached unvaccinated people or who did not complete vaccination and 80 percent of patients are children or adolescents, the CDC revealed on Friday. A school -age child died in late January in a region of the west of the state of Texas where 159 measles have been identified. Invisible enemy The SS warns that the measles are “a highly contagious disease that can be transmitted through the air, droplets or direct contact with nasopharyngeal secretions of an infected person. The incubation period is usually 7 to 18 days, but it can reach 21 days. ” The entity led by Alvis Lo adds that the measles is contagious four days before and after the appearance of skin eruptions, and has as “high fever symptoms (greater than 38 °), spots on the oral mucosa, systemic maculopapular eruption, conjunctivitis, cough and nasal discharge”. Once infected, children may develop complications such as otitis media, encephalitis and pneumonia. In severe cases, it may lead to hearing impairment, intellectual deficiency and even death. The vaccine against measles, bread and rubella is safe and highly effective in preventing severe infections and cases. The first dose is recommended for children from 12 to 15 months, and the second for children from 4 to 6 years old. Lusa / João Luz

item.title: GP Consumption | Ngan iek hang asks for adjustments in the program
item.description:
The residents deputy calls for greater flexibility of the program that aims to retain consumers in Macau and try to save trade from community neighborhoods in the face of interior competition
With the start of a new phase of the Grand Prix of Consumption scheduled for March 24, Deputy Ngan Iek Hang appealed to the government to solve the problems of the previous two editions, and facilitate the attribution of discounts. The big consumption award is a discount coupon distribution event, for residents who consume local commerce, and seeks to respond to consumer escape to the interior. “We want the government to dynamically adjust the great award for consumption. For example, we have received opinions from some residents that there is better more flexibility in the discount coupons and periods in which they can be used, ”said Ngan Iek Hang, who participated in a lecture on the center of collective wisdom policy, subordinate to the residents' association. In the previous way, residents needed to consume Monday to Friday to qualify to receive discount coupons, which had to be spent on the next weekend. If this were not the case, the discounts were valid. This format is considered problematic: “Residents explained to us that they need to work from Monday to Friday, or that they have to work by shifts [which prevents consumption on the days indicated],” said the deputy. "The period of qualification to participate in the discount coupons draws has to be broader and more flexible," he said. Praxe compliments Despite pointing out the need to improve the local commerce support program, Ngan Iek Hang pointed out that the initiative deserves to be praised as it also allows you to support the elderly and the most disadvantaged groups. In addition, Ngan Iek Hang cited merchants from Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs) of community neighborhoods who have confessed to lack of liquidity and difficulties to survive in the current economic context when they have to face loans during the pandemic. Given this subject, NGAN asks for the temporal extension of the aid in force: "We hope that the government will extend the measures that help the SMEs, such as interest without interest and the credit guarantee plan," he said. The residents' deputy also suggested to the government to do a study on consumption in the different community neighborhoods of Macao, based on data collected through the means of electronic payments, and that based on these data adjust companies support policies. On the other hand, Ngan Iek Hang considered that SMEs have to review their operational strategies and diversify products according to the trend of residents and tourists. The deputy also recalled that in recent years, the government has launched positive measures to digitize the SMEs.

item.title: Rua do Almirante Sérgio | Residents concerned with works
item.description: Yesterday the works of repairing and repairing the drainage system in Rua do Almirante Sérgio. The hope of the residents is that they come quickly to the end and have little impact on the area. The area in the interior port is one of the busiest arteries of the city, and the works aim to “improve the drainage network and the road floor”. However, a nickname resident Chio regretted that the areas in Rua do Almirante Sérgio and Rua da Praia do Manduco are always under construction, without any rest for residents. item.title: Game | Jefferies reduces 2% growth estimates
item.description:
The beginning of the year led the investment bank to moderate the game market growth prospects, but a more optimistic prediction is still adopted than the generality of analysts
The investment bank Jefferies reduced by 2 percent game growth estimates to 240 billion patacas. Prior to this low review, the estimates pointed to revenues to round the 245 billion patacas, predictions similar to those of the government. “After the results of the fourth quarter of 2024, and based on the January/February trend, we reviewed the estimates of the game's revenues,” read the latest report on the Macao market, quoted by Inside Asian Gaming and GGR Asia portals. The number reviewed down, still means a 5.8 percent growth compared to 2024. In the investor report it is indicated that this number represents, however, a higher estimate by 2 percent than consensual expectations among different analysts. According to Jeffries, the difference is explained by the fact that they expect the mass market to have a 6.9 percent growth throughout this year, while most analyzes are more conservative, pointing to a 4.8 percent growth. The highest level of visa visas for interior tourists are used to explain optimism: “We hope that the multiple entrance visa for Zhuhai residents, which came into force in January 2025, along with the multiple entrance visa for tourism groups, which was effective in May 2024, continuing to boost visits to Macau and the mass game recipes” justified. Compared to last year, the volume of revenues between January and February was similar, with a growth of 0.5 percent to 38 billion patacas. However, analysts expect to accelerate revenues between March and December. Market changes In addition to the review of bass estimates, analysts advanced with different estimates compared to local market quotas. With regard to this year and next, analysts believe that Sands China dealers, responsible for casinos such as The Venetian or Sands, and Galaxy, who manages the casino of the same name, will increase the proportion of revenue from competition. However, the speed of the increase will be lower than the initially expected: “However, as the trend of visitors in the two months of the year was not as high as it was expected, we slowed the rhythm of the increase in Sands China and Galaxy market share,” noted the institution. "With the number of visitors in 2025 to return to 94 percent of the 2019 level, it should be a good omen for large hotel operators, such as Sands China and Galaxy," said Jefferies. In terms of the scholarship market, the investment bank considers it to be a good time to invest in actions of all concessionaires except SJM, which still needs “more time to reinforce its profit margin in Greater Lisbon Palace” and also due to uncertainty linked to satellite casinos. Satellite casinos are casinos explored by dealers independent companies, but with their means, such as gaming tables, employees and gaming tables. The government wants to end these casinos by the end of the year, or at least that management is assumed in its entirety by the concessionaires.

item.title: Mahjong | CPSP detained 19 people in an illegal game room
item.description: The Public Security Police Corps (CPSP) announced the detention of 19 people in an illegal mahjong salon, located on the 7th floor of an industrial building on Quatro Street in the Iao Hon neighborhood. The case was released yesterday afternoon after the authorities' operation took place around 2 pm on Sunday. According to the CPSP, quoted by the newspaper or Mun, the investigation of the case began after a complaint about the existence of illegal game in one of the floors of the industrial building. Police decided to investigate the situation and when they entered the space found 18 players, including 11 men and 7 women, aged 32 to 75 years. In addition, another 60 -year -old man was arrested that authorities suspect being the space manager. Inside the industrial apartment were also seized five game tables, 4,900 cash patacas and another game material. Asked by the authorities, the alleged manager confessed that he had leased the space in September last year and that he paid about 19,000 Patacas of income. By the use of each game table, 100 patacas were charged per hour, and the space was open from 13h to 19h, every day, in interruptions. The detainee also confessed to having found profits of 120,000 patacas since opening in space and that on the day of detention he had a 330 patacas profit. In turn, the players said they got to know the space through conversation with friends. The case was referred to the prosecutor.

item.title: Seac Pai Van | Fire results in the hospitalization of two elderly
item.description:
The flames again triggered in the Lok Kuan building, in what was the fourth fire in housing buildings in about three weeks. Two elderly people were transported to the hospital, due to the inhalation of smoke and heart problems
A fire on Sunday night caused two wounds, and forced 24 more people to leave home. The flames triggered in Seac Pai Van, in the Lok Kuan building, in the fourth fire in housing buildings in about three weeks. According to the information cited yesterday by the Chinese channel of Radio Macau, the Fire Department (CB), after preliminary investigations, identified as possible cause of the flames a short circuit on the electric wires of a washing machine. The flames triggered around 10 pm, in one of the Varadas, where the machine was. Firefighters will take a short time to receive the alert and extinguish the fire, although if they had come across a lot of smoke coming from the vary. Despite the speed of the operation to extinguish the flames, 24 people had to abandon their dwellings, mainly due to the spread of smoke. As a consequence of the flames, part of the washing machine's electrical installations has been melted, as is the pipe to drain the water from the rod. Also much of the wall where the washing machine was was black. According to the newspaper or Mun, firefighters had to transport a 70 -year -old woman to the hospital due to the inhalation of fumes, as well as another 90 -year -old resident for feeling heart symptoms. Yesterday morning the condition of the two women was considered "stable". Successful cases In the last three weeks, four fires have been registered, with this largest of them, which forced two children with burns in at least 20 percent of the body and a woman had to be hospitalized. This is not the first time in these weeks that the Lok Kuan building is affected, as on February 26 a man died of a fire, which, according to the authorities, was started by himself. The man, who suffered from psychic problems, was found at home sitting in a chair with his feet tied. As a result of the recent vacancy of fireworks in housing buildings, some deputies, such as Lo Choi In and Si Ka Lon, asked authorities to adopt new security measures. Lo Choi In, a deputy linked to the Jiangmen community, was concerned about the fact that in the fire in the lake building the fire alarm did not work. In turn, Si Ka Lon appealed to the government to consider the hypothesis of funding the use of natural gas by supporting the installation in local buildings of distribution pipes. Also in recent days, the Fire Department has announced the intensification of activities to promote security and inspection measures, including a simulacrum in Seac Pai Van.

item.title: Zelensky vs Zelensky
item.description:
10/27/22 A renovated Ukrainian, with the same name of the president, guilty Zelensky about the extension of the conflict that destroyed his village. Zelensky, the village, who has never left his land, now lives mortified because his favorite gravedigger died in the bomber. This Zelensky, the village, represents half the world that reproves the other Zelensky, the villain, for not wanting to negotiate with Putin. Negotiate what? The invader enters us through the house, pies us the wife and daughter (cf. recent UN report on Ukraine violations in this “special operation”), an act that forced us to watch, and then we say: Alto there, we are for peace, but we have to negotiate: You have not said the name you want to give to children! A peace that is not worthy is but a cessation of rights. As severe as Russophobia that Putin inflicts his people.
10/28/22 In a lunch with several guests I hear a friend, who declares himself a spiritist, explaining about the particularities of his belief, in a serene and balanced way, would even say, without "irrationalism". He discussed long and serenely, devoid of any fanatical proselytizing. “Here is someone to whom belief brought weighting!” I thought, a rare alliance. However, at one point a phrase that horrify me. He says, “There is no chance, nothing happens by chance!” And I enter the voracious fauces of holism. Because holismo has a pathological aspect like all good things, a side of shadow. Two examples: In Hinduism there is less sensitivity to existential dramas, if that child suffers in this life this is only an expression of the strict karmic symmetry, an effect of the acts she committed in her previous life. In Africa it is not accepted that death may have been accidental, and many women are accused by the dead family of having caused her husband's death, in an act of manifest dementia, and, in the blatant majority of cases, in a huge injustice to his wife - madness that spreads and infiltrates the social fabric. Buddhism has introduced compassion and Christianity to Caritas, trying to break with this logic, but in many other beliefs and religions the cage of causalities prevails over sensitivity to experience, the need to respond to the now. It is a tremendous logic that transforms the world into a platonic stage, where we are just the shadows of something -an inextricable law -in a determinism that calcines all singularities, but strangely fascinates many. The conquest of modernity has anchored in the conquest of chance and random, subtracting the incidences of a life to this fierce determinism that closed the world in a web. When the Renaissance freed the body from the influence of the stars, at this moment sexuality was relieved of guilt and individualism and their volition could emerge. There is an unequivocal moral implication in the phrase “There is no chance, nothing happens by chance!”, Which should work as a key to self-knowledge and self-judgment, but usually this phrase is managed to seek a reason for things abroad from us in the other. It is an alibi. There is a holistic temptation in the world today, as in the Middle Ages there was a satanic temptation, without great reflection on its consequences. Because it is not enough we want to connect everything in a resonant chain of affection. Even the most unexpected: affection itself can kill. I realize, thanks to this cultured, balanced, intelligent woman, that “the combat” moved at the beginning of this century. One of the great misconceptions of the twentieth century was the false dichotomy between "rationalism and irrationalism", a debate that extended to all fields, including art. First, rationality was confused (the positive side of reason) with rationalism (the pathological feature of reason), and articulated in this lack of discernment was confused irrationalism with freedom. Almost all the art of the twentieth century, with surrealism to the head, worked in this error. The fallacy still exists despite having consolidated the emergence of 'irrationalism' and the consequent relativist currents that followed it. Essentially much of what happened in the twentieth century, it turned around this shock between two paradigms: rationalism versus irrationalism. Now, I see, the indetermination, chance, the random of the terrible temptation of the causal cage. Holism, in its pathological feature, can be the reductionism that is the way it puts the way as a new 'eschatological narrative'. Is it "by chance" that the holism emerges at the moment when neo-liberalism and its cynical contempt for the human person besides all freedoms, all acquired rights? Holistic consciousness has brought positively a greater ecological awareness but followed by scholastic rigor drifting reality under the blanket of a determinism that is much more than inconvenience: all great authoritarian ideologies are holistic. My friend will know how to combine her holistic and transpersonal belief with the freedom and responsibility that every moment asks us - but how many will make the destruction, under a law that explains and encompasses everything? How many will not be abandoned to what it is? The awareness of the indeterminate brings tragic conscience, as the Greeks knew, but also brings the will and the courage of the decision. And of this we cannot abdicate. In addition, as Drummond shows in Carlos Drummond de Andrade's poem “Quadrilha”: "John loved Teresa who loved Raimundo/ who loved Maria who loved Joaquim who loved Lili/ who did not love anyone./ John went to the United States, Teresa to the convent,/ Raimundo died of disaster, Maria stayed to aunt,/ Joaquim suicide himself and Lili married J. Pinto Fernandes/ who had not entered the story." Real always runs outside the track, in full exteriority to our concepts. This is what is worth a J. Pinto Fernandes at the exact moment we thought we had everything under control.

item.title: Nobel and others
item.description: 9/10/22 Reading many people's reactions when the Nobel Prize in this year's literature was announced, I couldn't help but remind me of this repair of Jean-Pierre Siméon, in relation to another Nobel Prize: “An editor of a large national newspaper wrote five lines of indignation because the Nobel Prize for Literature, a complete stranger. But unknown to whom? How did not occur to this patented and paid literary columnist to do his work, that his apparent ignorance was a matter of incorrect professional conduct? Tranströmer was translated into many languages, it was available in French. » There is always the choir of those who wait for the announcement of the prize to complain about not being invited to the jury of the prize, there is a subgroup of Irados that professes “never read and I will not bother to read”; It is an uncommon fauna, which inhabits social networks. I don't always know all the winners-I was unaware of the existence of Louise Glück, who I find a great poet, or the Olga Tokarczuk, for example-but it only brings me the comfort of knowing that the world is not a soap opera where everyone knows each other and the joy of recognizing that the gauge of the world is not measured with my short measure and that on the contrary it gives me a new opportunity to face the unknown. And perhaps the most cretin of reactions was the smart one who wrote, but there are still those who read French? There are books of her that I like less, like the vulgar "a simple passion," but this happens with almost every authors, they have a channel books and others that are like intervals in their itinerary. The summary they made of the book does not even deserve comments, by pathetic, but what matters to highlight is the note of disqualification about their "Mozambicanity" by calling it Luso-Mozambican. Because finally, following the same logic, Adelino Timóteo should be called Tsonga-Mozambican, to Álvaro Taruma-Mozambican, and Macua-Mozambican to the writers who are from the north, etc., etc. Which is not reported to happen. At the beyond moment, in the soap opera, she writes: «Our color has never been dominant. It took me a long time to accept that it was so because yes, and that it was no curse that were so; On the contrary, I could even discover intense patterns of fantasy and freedom in this shrewd cloak that is our genealogy… » In the current Mozambique it is white… and this is overlapping it soon to what it does or what it is.
